3.98. 
Right to compensation 
1. If the annexation of assets which are the personal property of a spouse has increased the value of assets which are the community property of the spouses, the spouse whose personal property has increased the value of the assets is entitled to compensation from the community property. 
2. A spouse is also entitled to compensation in cases where the spouse's personal funds were also used to acquire the property which is community property. 
3. Each spouse is obliged to compensate for the reduction in the community property if he or she has used the community property for purposes other than the fulfilment of the obligations provided for in Article 3.109 of this Code, unless he or she proves that the property has been used to meet family needs. 
4. The compensation provided for in this Article shall be payable when the community property ceases to exist.
